title: refactor(grpc): replace handle_error with handle_backend_error

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
This pull request refactors error handling for both download and upload gRPC server handlers by introducing a new asynchronous function to handle backend errors in a consistent and reusable way. The main focus is on improving code maintainability and clarity in error reporting.

Refactoring error handling:

* Added a new async function `handle_backend_error` in both `DfdaemonDownloadServerHandler` and `DfdaemonUploadServerHandler` to encapsulate the logic for sending backend errors to the output stream, replacing the previous direct calls to `handle_error` (`dragonfly-client/src/grpc/dfdaemon_download.rs`, `dragonfly-client/src/grpc/dfdaemon_upload.rs`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dR430-R440) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1R430-R440)
* Updated error handling calls to use the new `handle_backend_error` function instead of the previous `handle_error` function in both server handlers (`dragonfly-client/src/grpc/dfdaemon_download.rs`, `dragonfly-client/src/grpc/dfdaemon_upload.rs`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dL579-R590) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1L555-R566)<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

This pull request updates the CI workflow to optimize disk space usage during GitHub Actions runs. The main change is the addition of a step to free up disk space on the Ubuntu runner before checking out the code.

CI/CD workflow improvements:

title: feat(object_storage): add security token to OSS for dfdaemon and dfget

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body: ## Description This pull request updates the OSS object storage initialization logic to ensure that all required credentials are provided together, improving security and correctness. The changes focus on how the Operator is initialized with credentials in the ObjectStorage implementation. ### First commit commit https://github.com/dragonflyoss/client/commit/d8fec48469d4db1e10747cc721f8dfe5ee9b31e5 focuses on updating key dependencies, especially opendal and rustls related libraries, to their newer versions. The main purpose is to upgrade TLS-related dependencies to the dependency version of opendal v0.54.1 Major Dependency Updates: - Updated opendal from version 0.48.0 to 0.54.1 - Updated rustls from version 0.22.4 to 0.23.32 - Updated hyper-rustls from version 0.26 to 0.27.7 - Updated tokio-rustls from version 0.25.0-alpha.4 to 0.26 Dependency Configuration Adjustments: - Added default-features = false and ring feature to hyper-rustls and rustls - Added default-features = false and ring feature to tokio-rustls - These changes ensure consistent TLS backend usage across the project, by explicitly specifying the ring backend, which helps avoid the "Unknown TLS backend" errors that can occur in test environments. Opendal Related Updates: - remove opendal::Metakey fin hdfs/object_storage for https://opendal.apache.org/docs/rust/opendal/docs/rfcs/rfc_5314_remove_metakey/index.html ### Second commit commit https://github.com/dragonflyoss/client/commit/c6d5f0f0177f75631bc4210b9cad6b65a89b8d6a adds security token support for OSS (Object Storage Service) in both dfdaemon and dfget, allowing users to authenticate with temporary security credentials. This is particularly useful in cloud environments where temporary credentials are used for enhanced security. Object Storage Enhancement: - Added support for security tokens in OSS authentication within the [ObjectStorage](javascript:void(0)) implementation - Modified the OSS operator initialization to conditionally include the security token when provided - Refactored the OSS builder initialization to use a conditional expression that either includes or excludes the security token based on its presence Command-line Interface Updates: - Added a new command-line argument --storage-security-token to dfget for specifying the security token for OSS - Integrated the security token into the object storage configuration in both download directory and file download functions Dependency Updates: - Updated workspace package version from 1.0.32 to 1.0.33 - Updated dragonfly-api dependency from version 2.1.78 to 2.1.80 ## Test For new build dfget/dfdaemon binary, it's ok to use dfget to download files

title: feat(client): add parent_addr logging to download_piece

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request enhances the observability of piece downloads in both the QUIC and TCP clients by improving tracing instrumentation. The changes add a new `parent_addr` field to the tracing spans, allowing you to see which parent address is associated with each download operation in the logs.

**Tracing enhancements:**

* Added the `parent_addr` field to the tracing span in the `download_piece` method for both `QUICClient` and `TCPClient`, enabling better identification of the source address in traces. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8L61-R68) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-310d4eac37200650a61284af74174f541446de46c9086dca1e90998dcab4916dL56-R63)
* Imported `Span` from the `tracing` crate in `tcp.rs` to support span field recording.

title: feat(http): add default proxy rule filtered query params

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
This pull request refactors how filtered query parameters are managed and used when generating task IDs for proxy requests in the Dragonfly client. The main change is moving the logic for determining default filtered query parameters out of `dragonfly-client-config` and into a new module in `dragonfly-client-util`, consolidating related code and tests. This improves code organization and ensures that default query parameters are consistently applied when none are provided.

**Refactoring and Code Organization:**

* Moved all filtered query parameter logic (for S3, GCS, OSS, OBS, COS, containerd, and the default proxy rule) from `dragonfly-client-config/src/dfdaemon.rs` to a new module `dragonfly-client-util/src/http/query_params.rs`, including associated tests. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-1d4c7839a6a08bcaef14196c90b20366303b24b2826e1bc9123574a815e7c1ddL291-L393) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-c2b8cdda2e240c6eacd27362f59a05cc5ac0ee6d6fd31d2c1dac37b48d40661dR1-R164)
* Updated imports in `dragonfly-client-config/src/dfdaemon.rs`, `dragonfly-client-util/src/http/mod.rs`, and `dragonfly-client-util/src/request/mod.rs` to use the new `query_params` module for `default_proxy_rule_filtered_query_params`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-1d4c7839a6a08bcaef14196c90b20366303b24b2826e1bc9123574a815e7c1ddR24-L31) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-400949f43c53c2d5833a394806a0d9cd7360a7c9f99b9ad101c5f58e3c44e98dR26) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-fa1268097df5106739708976eb7640440dd6f057e9c7f60745b3bb1dd8194225L20-R20)

**Behavioral Improvements:**

* In the proxy logic (`dragonfly-client-util/src/request/mod.rs`), now uses the default filtered query parameters if none are specified in the request, ensuring consistent and correct task ID generation. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-fa1268097df5106739708976eb7640440dd6f057e9c7f60745b3bb1dd8194225R416-R421) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-fa1268097df5106739708976eb7640440dd6f057e9c7f60745b3bb1dd8194225L426-R449)

**Debug Logging Enhancements:**

* Improved debug logging to include the task ID when logging selected seed peers and expected replicas, making logs more informative for troubleshooting. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-fa1268097df5106739708976eb7640440dd6f057e9c7f60745b3bb1dd8194225L426-R449) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL209-R209)<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Bumps [regex](https://github.com/rust-lang/regex) from 1.11.3 to 1.12.2.
Changelog

Sourced from regex's changelog.

1.12.2 (2025-10-13)

This release fixes a cargo doc breakage on nightly when --cfg docsrs is enabled. This caused documentation to fail to build on docs.rs.

Bug fixes:

  • [BUG #1305](rust-lang/regex#1305): Switches the doc_auto_cfg feature to doc_cfg on nightly for docs.rs builds.

1.12.1 (2025-10-10)

This release makes a bug fix in the new regex::Captures::get_match API introduced in 1.12.0. There was an oversight with the lifetime parameter for the Match returned. This is technically a breaking change, but given that it was caught almost immediately and I've yanked the 1.12.0 release, I think this is fine.

1.12.0 (2025-10-10)

This release contains a smattering of bug fixes, a fix for excessive memory consumption in some cases and a new regex::Captures::get_match API.

Improvements:

  • [FEATURE #1146](rust-lang/regex#1146): Add Capture::get_match for returning the overall match without unwrap().

Bug fixes:

  • [BUG #1083](rust-lang/regex#1083): Fixes a panic in the lazy DFA (can only occur for especially large regexes).
  • [BUG #1116](rust-lang/regex#1116): Fixes a memory usage regression for large regexes (introduced in regex 1.9).
  • [BUG #1195](rust-lang/regex#1195): Fix universal start states in sparse DFA.
  • [BUG #1295](rust-lang/regex#1295): Fixes a panic when deserializing a corrupted dense DFA.
  • BUG 8f5d9479: Make regex_automata::meta::Regex::find consistently return None when WhichCaptures::None is used.

Sourced from github/codeql-action's releases.

v4.30.9

CodeQL Action Changelog

See the releases page for the relevant changes to the CodeQL CLI and language packs.

4.30.9 - 17 Oct 2025

  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.23.3. #3205
  • Experimental: A new setup-codeql action has been added which is similar to init, except it only installs the CodeQL CLI and does not initialize a database. Do not use this in production as it is part of an internal experiment and subject to change at any time. #3204

See the full CHANGELOG.md for more information.

Changelog

Sourced from github/codeql-action's changelog.

CodeQL Action Changelog

See the releases page for the relevant changes to the CodeQL CLI and language packs.

[UNRELEASED]

No user facing changes.

4.30.9 - 17 Oct 2025

  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.23.3. #3205
  • Experimental: A new setup-codeql action has been added which is similar to init, except it only installs the CodeQL CLI and does not initialize a database. Do not use this in production as it is part of an internal experiment and subject to change at any time. #3204

4.30.8 - 10 Oct 2025

No user facing changes.

4.30.7 - 06 Oct 2025

  • [v4+ only] The CodeQL Action now runs on Node.js v24. #3169

3.30.6 - 02 Oct 2025

  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.23.2. #3168

3.30.5 - 26 Sep 2025

  • We fixed a bug that was introduced in 3.30.4 with upload-sarif which resulted in files without a .sarif extension not getting uploaded. #3160

3.30.4 - 25 Sep 2025

  • We have improved the CodeQL Action's ability to validate that the workflow it is used in does not use different versions of the CodeQL Action for different workflow steps. Mixing different versions of the CodeQL Action in the same workflow is unsupported and can lead to unpredictable results. A warning will now be emitted from the codeql-action/init step if different versions of the CodeQL Action are detected in the workflow file. Additionally, an error will now be thrown by the other CodeQL Action steps if they load a configuration file that was generated by a different version of the codeql-action/init step. #3099 and #3100
  • We added support for reducing the size of dependency caches for Java analyses, which will reduce cache usage and speed up workflows. This will be enabled automatically at a later time. #3107
  • You can now run the latest CodeQL nightly bundle by passing tools: nightly to the init action. In general, the nightly bundle is unstable and we only recommend running it when directed by GitHub staff. #3130
  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.23.1. #3118

3.30.3 - 10 Sep 2025

No user facing changes.

3.30.2 - 09 Sep 2025

  • Fixed a bug which could cause language autodetection to fail. #3084
  • Experimental: The quality-queries input that was added in 3.29.2 as part of an internal experiment is now deprecated and will be removed in an upcoming version of the CodeQL Action. It has been superseded by a new analysis-kinds input, which is part of the same internal experiment. Do not use this in production as it is subject to change at any time. #3064

3.30.1 - 05 Sep 2025

  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.23.0. #3077

3.30.0 - 01 Sep 2025

title: feat(deps): remove quinn dependency from dragonfly-client-core

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request removes the dependency on the `quinn` crate from the workspace and refactors error handling for QUIC-related operations in both the client and server code. Instead of using custom `From<quinn::Error>` conversions, the code now consistently uses the `OrErr` trait and `ErrorType::ConnectError` for error mapping. Additionally, all crate versions are bumped to `1.0.31`.

Dependency and version updates:
- Removed the `quinn` dependency from `dragonfly-client-core/Cargo.toml`, indicating that direct usage of the `quinn` crate is no longer needed in this crate.
- Updated the workspace and all internal crate versions from `1.0.30` to `1.0.31` in `Cargo.toml`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L16-R16) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L26-R33)

Error handling refactor:
- Removed all `From<quinn::Error>` implementations from `dragonfly-client-core/src/error/mod.rs`, eliminating the old error conversion approach for QUIC errors.
- Refactored QUIC-related async operations in both `dragonfly-client-storage/src/client/quic.rs` and `dragonfly-client-storage/src/server/quic.rs` to use `.or_err(ErrorType::ConnectError)?` for error mapping, ensuring consistent and explicit error handling. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8L207-R223) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8L236-R241) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8L260-R275) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L107-R112) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L470-R476) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L494-R501) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L513-R521)
- Updated imports in `dragonfly-client-storage/src/server/quic.rs` to bring in the `OrErr` trait and `ErrorType` for the new error handling approach.

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
This pull request removes the use of the `#[instrument]` tracing macro from several async methods in both `dragonfly-client-util/src/request/mod.rs` and `dragonfly-client-util/src/request/selector.rs`. This change simplifies the codebase by reducing tracing overhead and cleaning up imports.

Tracing and instrumentation cleanup:

* Removed the `#[instrument(skip_all)]` macro from multiple async methods in the `Proxy` and `SeedPeerSelector` implementations, including `get`, `get_into`, `client_entries`, `try_send`, `send`, `make_request_headers`, `refresh`, `list_seed_peers`, `check_health`, and `select`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-fa1268097df5106739708976eb7640440dd6f057e9c7f60745b3bb1dd8194225L355) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-fa1268097df5106739708976eb7640440dd6f057e9c7f60745b3bb1dd8194225L381) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-fa1268097df5106739708976eb7640440dd6f057e9c7f60745b3bb1dd8194225L414) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-fa1268097df5106739708976eb7640440dd6f057e9c7f60745b3bb1dd8194225L461) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-fa1268097df5106739708976eb7640440dd6f057e9c7f60745b3bb1dd8194225L494) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-fa1268097df5106739708976eb7640440dd6f057e9c7f60745b3bb1dd8194225L548) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL114) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL172) [[9]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL184) [[10]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL203)

title: feat(metadata): add piece_count method to task structs

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request introduces several improvements and refactorings across the codebase, primarily focused on enhancing piece count tracking, simplifying task management logic, and updating dependencies. The most significant changes are the addition of `piece_count` methods to task-related structs, updates to the logic for handling download and upload tasks, and dependency version bumps.

**Enhancements to piece count tracking:**

- Added `piece_count` methods to `Task`, `PersistentCacheTask`, and `CacheTask` structs to calculate the number of pieces for a task based on content and piece length, improving accuracy and consistency in piece management. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-58e1a6463adbab70df687ead673404e28a954e0a3e955683356e63eda00dcfe9R125-R131) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-58e1a6463adbab70df687ead673404e28a954e0a3e955683356e63eda00dcfe9R226-R230) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-58e1a6463adbab70df687ead673404e28a954e0a3e955683356e63eda00dcfe9R326-R332)
- Updated the download and upload server handlers (`DfdaemonDownloadServerHandler` and `DfdaemonUploadServerHandler`) to set `actual_piece_count` using the new `piece_count` method, and to record content and piece lengths as `Option<u64>` for improved robustness. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dL345-R357) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1L345-R357)

**Task management and code simplification:**

- Refactored logic in download/upload handlers to consistently use `self.task` for task management, removing redundant local clones and streamlining error handling. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dL386-R368) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dL404-R391) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dL429-R412) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dL645-R632) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1L385-R368) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1L403-R391) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1L428-R412) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1L620-R608)
- Updated the persistent cache task logic to include `piece_count` in requests and to simplify request construction by removing unused fields. Also improved concurrency handling by using `.in_current_span()` with spawned tasks. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8R740) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8L842-R843) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8L949-R948) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8L1223-R1221) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8L1240-R1241)

**Dependency and configuration updates:**

- Bumped the workspace package version to `1.0.29` and updated the `dragonfly-api` dependency version to `2.1.78` in `Cargo.toml`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L16-R16) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L34-R34)
- Minor configuration clean-up in `dfdaemon.rs` by removing the unused `disableBackToSource` field.

**Other improvements:**

- Added missing fields (`actual_piece_length`, `actual_content_length`, `actual_piece_count`) to `make_download_task_request` for completeness.
- Fixed tracing import and ensured spawned tasks in selectors and persistent cache tasks are instrumented with the current tracing span. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL34-R34) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL131-R139)

**API and interface adjustments:**

- Removed unused parameters (such as `content_length`) from internal task management functions and request structs, and updated related call sites accordingly. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L456) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L549) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L674-R672)

4.30.8 - 10 Oct 2025

No user facing changes.

  • [v4+ only] The CodeQL Action now runs on Node.js v24. #3169

3.30.6 - 02 Oct 2025

  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.23.2. #3168

3.30.5 - 26 Sep 2025

  • We fixed a bug that was introduced in 3.30.4 with upload-sarif which resulted in files without a .sarif extension not getting uploaded. #3160

3.30.4 - 25 Sep 2025

  • We have improved the CodeQL Action's ability to validate that the workflow it is used in does not use different versions of the CodeQL Action for different workflow steps. Mixing different versions of the CodeQL Action in the same workflow is unsupported and can lead to unpredictable results. A warning will now be emitted from the codeql-action/init step if different versions of the CodeQL Action are detected in the workflow file. Additionally, an error will now be thrown by the other CodeQL Action steps if they load a configuration file that was generated by a different version of the codeql-action/init step. #3099 and #3100
  • We added support for reducing the size of dependency caches for Java analyses, which will reduce cache usage and speed up workflows. This will be enabled automatically at a later time. #3107
  • You can now run the latest CodeQL nightly bundle by passing tools: nightly to the init action. In general, the nightly bundle is unstable and we only recommend running it when directed by GitHub staff. #3130
  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.23.1. #3118

3.30.3 - 10 Sep 2025

No user facing changes.

3.30.2 - 09 Sep 2025

  • Fixed a bug which could cause language autodetection to fail. #3084
  • Experimental: The quality-queries input that was added in 3.29.2 as part of an internal experiment is now deprecated and will be removed in an upcoming version of the CodeQL Action. It has been superseded by a new analysis-kinds input, which is part of the same internal experiment. Do not use this in production as it is subject to change at any time. #3064

3.30.1 - 05 Sep 2025

  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.23.0. #3077

3.30.0 - 01 Sep 2025

  • Reduce the size of the CodeQL Action, speeding up workflows by approximately 4 seconds. #3054

title: refactor(storage): consolidate task preparation logic

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
This pull request refactors the logic for preparing download tasks in the storage layer, improving how task metadata is reused and introducing clearer checks for resumable tasks. The changes streamline the process of determining when a download task can be resumed and ensure that metadata is managed more robustly.

**Download Task Preparation and Reuse**

* Refactored the task preparation method in `Storage` to `prepare_download_task`, which now returns both the task metadata and a boolean indicating whether the task can be reused. This replaces the previous `prepare_download_task_started` method and clarifies the API for consumers.
* Added a new method `prepare_download_task` in `Metadata`, which checks if an existing task can be reused based on content length, piece length, and failure status. If the task cannot be reused, its metadata is updated; if it doesn't exist, a new task is created.
* Updated the usage in the `Task` resource to use the new `prepare_download_task` method and handle the reuse flag, simplifying the logic for linking files when tasks are reused.

**Resumable Task Checks**

* Added an `is_task_resumable` method to `Storage`, which determines if a task is resumable by checking for content length, piece length, and ensuring the task has not failed. This provides a clear interface for resumability checks.

title: fix(resource): add defer for residual piece cleanup

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
This pull request introduces improved resource cleanup for piece metadata in the `Task` implementation to ensure incomplete or canceled pieces are properly handled. The changes utilize the `scopeguard` crate's `defer!` macro to automatically clean up residual piece metadata when a piece download is interrupted or incomplete, reducing the risk of inconsistent state.

**Dependency Addition:**

* Added the `scopeguard` crate as a new dependency in `Cargo.toml` to support deferred cleanup logic.

**Resource Cleanup Enhancements:**

* Imported and enabled the `defer!` macro from `scopeguard` in `src/lib.rs`.

* In the async tasks for downloading pieces from a parent or source in `task.rs`, added deferred cleanup logic using `defer!` to mark unfinished pieces as failed, ensuring piece metadata is consistent if the download is incomplete or canceled. This logic was added to three separate async download task spawns:
  - Download from parent [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1193-R1213) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5R1232)
  - Download from source (two locations) [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5R1466-R1485) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5R1862-R1881)<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

title: refactor(http): improve HTTP request handling logic

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request primarily refactors the HTTP backend implementation in `dragonfly-client-backend` to improve error handling and robustness for HTTP requests, especially around handling 416 (Range Not Satisfiable) responses. It also includes a minor cleanup in the TCP server code by removing an unused configuration field, and a small import cleanup in the utilities module.

### HTTP Backend Improvements
* Improved handling of HTTP HEAD requests: If a 416 (Range Not Satisfiable) response is received (which can happen for zero-byte files), the code now retries the request without the Range header to properly retrieve headers. This makes the client more robust to edge cases in server responses.
* Enhanced error handling: If the HTTP request fails, the function now logs the error and returns a structured failure response, instead of panicking or propagating the error.
* Refactored variable naming: Renamed variables like `header` and `status_code` to `request_header`, `response_header`, and `response_status_code` for clarity and consistency throughout the HTTP backend implementation. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acL169-R169) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acL181-R183) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acL243-R280) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acL253-R290) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acL275-R330)
* Added `info` logging to trace retries and improved debug output for HTTP responses. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acL26-R26) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acR194-R209)

### TCP Server Cleanup
* Removed the unused `config` field from the `TCPServer` struct and its constructor in `dragonfly-client-storage`, simplifying the server's state. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048L20) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048L51-L53) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048L71) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048L80)

### Utilities Module Cleanup
* Removed an unused import (`RawFd`) from `dragonfly-client-util/src/net/mod.rs` to clean up the codebase.

v3.30.6

v3.30.5

CodeQL Action Changelog

See the releases page for the relevant changes to the CodeQL CLI and language packs.

3.30.5 - 26 Sep 2025

  • We fixed a bug that was introduced in 3.30.4 with upload-sarif which resulted in files without a .sarif extension not getting uploaded. #3160

See the full CHANGELOG.md for more information.

v3.30.4

CodeQL Action Changelog

See the releases page for the relevant changes to the CodeQL CLI and language packs.

3.30.4 - 25 Sep 2025

  • We have improved the CodeQL Action's ability to validate that the workflow it is used in does not use different versions of the CodeQL Action for different workflow steps. Mixing different versions of the CodeQL Action in the same workflow is unsupported and can lead to unpredictable results. A warning will now be emitted from the codeql-action/init step if different versions of the CodeQL Action are detected in the workflow file. Additionally, an error will now be thrown by the other CodeQL Action steps if they load a configuration file that was generated by a different version of the codeql-action/init step. #3099 and #3100
  • We added support for reducing the size of dependency caches for Java analyses, which will reduce cache usage and speed up workflows. This will be enabled automatically at a later time. #3107
  • You can now run the latest CodeQL nightly bundle by passing tools: nightly to the init action. In general, the nightly bundle is unstable and we only recommend running it when directed by GitHub staff. #3130
  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.23.1. #3118

See the full CHANGELOG.md for more information.

title: feat(tcp): support TCP Fast Open for client and server

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request introduces support for TCP Fast Open (TFO) in the storage server and client, making network connections more efficient by reducing latency during TCP handshakes. It adds configuration options, implements platform-specific logic for enabling TFO on Linux, and cleans up platform checks in file comparison logic. The most important changes are grouped below:

**TCP Fast Open Support**

* Added a new `tcp_fastopen` boolean field to the `StorageServer` struct in `dfdaemon.rs`, with documentation and a default value of `false`. This allows enabling/disabling TCP Fast Open via configuration. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-1d4c7839a6a08bcaef14196c90b20366303b24b2826e1bc9123574a815e7c1ddR968-R972) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-1d4c7839a6a08bcaef14196c90b20366303b24b2826e1bc9123574a815e7c1ddR984)
* Implemented `set_tcp_fastopen` and `set_tcp_fastopen_connect` functions in `dragonfly-client-util/src/net/mod.rs` to enable TCP Fast Open for server and client sockets on Linux, using the `libc` crate. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-c73bd66037007187e1cf43dc7c2e8f381fe2894c0e4879ae154bef9a46bcaa08R23) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-c73bd66037007187e1cf43dc7c2e8f381fe2894c0e4879ae154bef9a46bcaa08R188-R235) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-1c96c45400d8ecf785eb0acb8bced3fbd8838ce5882e449bb66aceaf5497021dR50)
* Updated the TCP client (`client/tcp.rs`) and server (`server/tcp.rs`) to call these functions conditionally based on the `tcp_fastopen` config and platform, with appropriate logging. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-310d4eac37200650a61284af74174f541446de46c9086dca1e90998dcab4916dR182-R195) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048R102-R118)

**Platform-specific File Comparison Cleanup**

* Simplified the implementation of `is_same_dev_inode` in both `content_linux.rs` and `content_macos.rs` by removing unnecessary `#[cfg(unix)]` and `#[cfg(not(unix))]` checks, making the code more concise and readable. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-14656a0beba1f862d613174e11202e6acc58af3a312f47bfe34424eb27e87d60R22) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-14656a0beba1f862d613174e11202e6acc58af3a312f47bfe34424eb27e87d60L123-L138)

These changes make it easier to enable TCP Fast Open for improved connection performance and clarify platform-specific logic in file handling.

title: feat(tcp): optimize TCP socket configuration for 4M-64M data chunk transfers

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request introduces several network performance optimizations and configuration changes across the HTTP and TCP client/server modules, primarily focused on increasing buffer sizes, fine-tuning HTTP/2 settings, and enabling advanced TCP features like Fast Open and congestion control. These changes are intended to improve throughput and efficiency, especially for high-bandwidth or high-latency environments.

**Network Buffer and Window Size Increases:**

- Increased default send and receive buffer sizes from 4 MiB to 16 MiB in both `dragonfly-client-storage/src/client/mod.rs` and `dragonfly-client-storage/src/server/mod.rs` to support higher throughput.
- Set HTTP/2 stream and connection window sizes to 16 MiB by default, and applied these settings to HTTP and ObjectStorage clients for better flow control and parallelism. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6acac939bcda338ef32b3d844b2a6dad132f231935dd23bb8eead046b3effe94R48-R53) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acR73-R79) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acR128-R134) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37R190-R193)

**TCP and HTTP/2 Feature Enhancements:**

- Enabled TCP_NODELAY and HTTP/2 adaptive window, keep-alive, and related advanced settings in HTTP and ObjectStorage client builders, reducing latency and improving connection stability. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acR73-R79) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acR128-R134) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37R190-R193)
- Enabled TCP Fast Open for both TCP client and server on Linux, reducing connection setup latency. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-310d4eac37200650a61284af74174f541446de46c9086dca1e90998dcab4916dR182-R193) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048L102-L106)
- Changed TCP congestion control algorithm from "bbr" to "cubic" on the server, which may provide better performance in certain network conditions.

**Storage Buffer Configuration Updates:**

- Increased the default disk read and write buffer sizes for storage from 128 KiB to 4 MiB in the configuration struct, allowing for more efficient disk I/O.

**Dependency Update:**

- Added the `nix` crate with `socket` and `net` features to support low-level socket options for TCP Fast Open and congestion control.

These changes collectively target improved network and storage performance, especially for scenarios requiring high throughput and low latency.
<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->

title: feat(dependencies): update tcp and quic config

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request updates the network configuration and buffer management for both QUIC and TCP clients and servers in the `dragonfly-client-storage` package. The changes standardize buffer sizes and keepalive settings, switch from the `nix` crate to `socket2` for socket operations, and ensure consistent configuration of TCP and QUIC transport parameters. Additionally, all workspace dependencies are bumped to version 1.0.26.

**Network Configuration Improvements:**

* Introduced constants for default send/receive buffer sizes and keepalive intervals in both `client/mod.rs` and `server/mod.rs`, used throughout the client and server implementations for consistent configuration.
* QUIC client and server transport settings now use these constants for keepalive interval, idle timeout, send/receive window sizes, and stream receive window sizes, replacing hardcoded values. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8L195-R196) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L94-R98)

**TCP Socket Management Enhancements:**

* Migrated from the `nix` crate to the `socket2` crate for TCP socket configuration, allowing direct setting of buffer sizes, keepalive intervals, and TCP_NODELAY for both client and server sockets. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-646c14b277a6afe2521324f3047193b744dfb61e924e1e1c6a1c71e7d12dd302L38-R38) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-310d4eac37200650a61284af74174f541446de46c9086dca1e90998dcab4916dR20-R23) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048R26)
* Updated TCP client connection logic to configure socket options immediately after connecting, and similarly updated TCP server to configure socket options before binding and listening. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-310d4eac37200650a61284af74174f541446de46c9086dca1e90998dcab4916dL175-R183) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048L87-R116)

**Dependency and Version Updates:**

* Bumped the workspace and all `dragonfly-client-*` crate dependencies from version 1.0.25 to 1.0.26 in `Cargo.toml` for consistency. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L16-R16) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L26-R33)
* Removed the `nix` dependency from `dragonfly-client-storage/Cargo.toml` and added `socket2` as a replacement.

**Code Cleanup:**

* Removed unnecessary imports of `Duration` and the BBR congestion controller in QUIC client/server files, as congestion control is now set via the new configuration approach. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8L24-L31) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L31)

**Linux-specific TCP Congestion Control:**

* Updated the Linux-specific logic for setting TCP congestion control to BBR using `socket2` instead of `nix`, improving cross-platform compatibility and code clarity.

<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request updates the TCP server implementation in the `dragonfly-client-storage` crate to use the standard `tokio::net::TcpListener` and `tokio::net::TcpStream` types instead of custom aliases, and introduces the `nix` crate to enable advanced socket options. The changes improve maintainability and add support for configuring TCP congestion control.

**Socket API improvements:**

* Added the `nix` crate with `socket` and `net` features to `Cargo.toml` to enable manipulation of socket options for TCP connections.
* Imported `nix::sys::socket::{setsockopt, sockopt::TcpCongestion}` and `std::os::unix::io::AsRawFd` in `tcp.rs` to allow setting TCP congestion control algorithms.

**Codebase modernization and consistency:**

* Replaced usage of `TokioTcpListener` and `TokioTcpStream` with `TcpListener` and `TcpStream` throughout the TCP server code, simplifying type usage and aligning with standard `tokio` APIs. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048R26-R33) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048L87-R94) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048L138-R143)
* Obtained the raw file descriptor from the TCP listener to facilitate socket option configuration.

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request refactors and improves QUIC (using the `quinn` crate) support across the client and storage components, with a particular focus on error handling, configuration, and code clarity. It introduces more granular error variants for QUIC operations, simplifies downloader instantiation, and streamlines connection handling and logging for QUIC servers.

### QUIC error handling improvements

* Added specific error variants for QUIC operations (connect, connection, write, read, etc.) to the `DFError` enum in `dragonfly-client-core/src/error/mod.rs`, enabling more precise error reporting and propagation. Removed old conversion implementations that mapped all QUIC errors to `Unknown`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-30b34d1fd4f012f66569fffc95749e5627c7a8bb3720dbcea2fa6659a7a5f85bR173-R204) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-30b34d1fd4f012f66569fffc95749e5627c7a8bb3720dbcea2fa6659a7a5f85bL253-L284)

### QUIC crate dependency management

* Updated `Cargo.toml` files to use workspace dependencies for `quinn`, ensuring consistent versioning and easier dependency management across crates. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542R120) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f98e164844f1b2f843ad116d8fcb9a8c66714535ffa2671a0bd631748ea368daL26-R26) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-646c14b277a6afe2521324f3047193b744dfb61e924e1e1c6a1c71e7d12dd302R34-L37)

### QUIC client and server connection improvements

* Refactored QUIC client connection setup in `dragonfly-client-storage/src/client/quic.rs` to streamline configuration, error handling, and certificate verification (with improved documentation for the no-op verifier). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8L19-R26) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8L175-R193) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8R294) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8R303-R305) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8R317) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8R332) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-db71b7660172d45fc8969c9de9063b8a94f52782f017b6763d464604d6be49d8R347)
* Improved QUIC server connection acceptance and logging in `dragonfly-client-storage/src/server/quic.rs`, including more robust error handling and clearer remote address tracking. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L86-R105) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L134-R156) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L184-R181) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L206-R203) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L228-R225) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L240-R234) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L266-R258) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L295-R287) [[9]](diffhunk://#diff-dbf426132604e055f41fcdd40db868a0904c8b28925917584ab74881f33b87b9L306-R296)

### Downloader instantiation and usage

* Refactored the `Piece` struct in `dragonfly-client/src/resource/piece.rs` to instantiate the QUIC downloader once during construction, instead of lazily creating a new one for each download. Updated download logic to use the cached downloader instance. title: feat(export): add overwrite option for output files

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request introduces several improvements and fixes across the storage, upload/download server handlers, configuration, and dependency management in the Dragonfly client. The most notable changes include enhanced overwrite handling during file operations, improved resource cleanup on task failures, updates to API usage, and a dependency bump for the `dragonfly-api` crate.

**Overwrite handling improvements:**

* Added logic in both `DfdaemonDownloadServerHandler` and `DfdaemonUploadServerHandler` to check for the `overwrite` flag when the output file already exists. If `overwrite` is true, the server attempts to copy the task output to the specified path, handling errors gracefully and avoiding duplicate error messages. This ensures better user experience and correctness when overwriting files. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dR496-R511) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dR1082-R1094) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1R492-R507) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1R1281-R1293)
* Set the `overwrite` field to `false` by default in the download task request construction to clarify default behavior.

**Resource cleanup on task failures:**

* Updated the `Storage` implementation to delete associated content when a download or persistent cache task fails, ensuring no orphaned data remains and improving resource management. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eL144-R147) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eL311-R317)

**API and dependency updates:**

* Updated the `dragonfly-api` dependency from version `2.1.68` to `2.1.70` in `Cargo.toml` to stay up-to-date with upstream changes.
* Modified the seed peer selector to use the new `ListHostsRequest` struct when listing hosts, aligning with the updated API. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL20-R20) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL171-R172)

**Documentation and minor improvements:**

* Clarified the documentation comment for the `ip` field in the `StorageServer` struct to specify it is the storage server's listen IP.

## Description
This pull request introduces several improvements and refactorings to the client utility and backend modules, focusing on better error handling, code documentation, and enhancements to the client pool and seed peer selection logic. The most important changes are grouped below.

**Error Handling Improvements:**

* Refactored `dragonfly-client-util/src/request/errors.rs` to provide more descriptive error variants, replacing generic error types with specific ones such as `RequestTimeout`, `InvalidArgument`, and `Internal`. Enhanced documentation for error structs and improved error messages for backend, proxy, and dfdaemon errors. **Client Pool Enhancements:**

* Improved documentation and comments throughout `dragonfly-client-util/src/pool/mod.rs`, clarifying the purpose and behavior of types and methods. Changed the method for updating client activity time from `update_actived_at()` to `set_actived_at()` for greater flexibility. Added and documented builder and pool management logic. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-52920cc7a57935a341b69eb40862109c05e0cff53bb5b20fc00786e89a92496cR37-R48) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-52920cc7a57935a341b69eb40862109c05e0cff53bb5b20fc00786e89a92496cR67-R69) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-52920cc7a57935a341b69eb40862109c05e0cff53bb5b20fc00786e89a92496cL78-R85) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-52920cc7a57935a341b69eb40862109c05e0cff53bb5b20fc00786e89a92496cR105) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-52920cc7a57935a341b69eb40862109c05e0cff53bb5b20fc00786e89a92496cR129-R137) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-52920cc7a57935a341b69eb40862109c05e0cff53bb5b20fc00786e89a92496cR178-R185) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-52920cc7a57935a341b69eb40862109c05e0cff53bb5b20fc00786e89a92496cL185-L197) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-52920cc7a57935a341b69eb40862109c05e0cff53bb5b20fc00786e89a92496cL234)

Enhanced health check and selection mechanisms, improved error propagation, and clarified variable naming and selection logic. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL21-R24) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cR39) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cR49) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cR58) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL63-R73) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL89-L92) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL102-R105) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL138-R147) [[9]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL182-R196) [[10]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cL203-R222) [[11]](diffhunk://#diff-6322522f00d2c05acee4db2a9c5cea00a02a8afe4ee9b3b188d2b11887bd188cR232-R235)

## Description
This pull request makes a minor update to the logic for determining the download server IP address in the `DfdaemonUploadServerHandler` implementation. The change ensures the IP is consistently sourced from the correct configuration field.

* The download server IP address is now retrieved from `self.config.host.ip` instead of `self.config.storage.server.ip` in the `dragonfly-client/src/grpc/dfdaemon_upload.rs` file. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1L790-R790) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1L1498-R1498)

title: feat(metric): add dragonfly-client-metric module

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request introduces a new crate, `dragonfly-client-metric`, to centralize metric collection functionality for the Dragonfly client. The integration refactors existing metric-related code to use this new crate, updates dependencies and workspace configuration, and ensures the crate is properly included in Docker builds and other client modules.

### Metric Collection Refactoring

* Introduced the new crate `dragonfly-client-metric` with its own `Cargo.toml`, consolidating all metric collection logic previously scattered across the codebase.
* Refactored imports in multiple modules (`dfdaemon_download.rs`, `dfdaemon_upload.rs`, `mod.rs`, `proxy/mod.rs`, `piece.rs`, `task.rs`, `tcp.rs`) to use metric functions from `dragonfly-client-metric` instead of the old local `metrics` module. This improves maintainability and modularity. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dL17-L25) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dR38-R46) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1L17-L24) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1R41-R48) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-d859a94a5da0dde503031572af96e4c4e81cf8b4d702db0b332d8d4bf6153356L17-R21) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-6421011d65f9faa2a693ea46e321cc00e07b77ef8792a1b795d1db98d9e5ec4cL18-L21) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-6421011d65f9faa2a693ea46e321cc00e07b77ef8792a1b795d1db98d9e5ec4cR28-R31) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-475bfaadbebd4a013fc563ecdf5dc59fc9f5258738fc46ff30b0ac3cea0ad515L18-R27) [[9]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L18-L21) [[10]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5R42-R45) [[11]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048R21-R23)

### Workspace and Dependency Updates

* Added `dragonfly-client-metric` to the workspace members and as a dependency in relevant crates (`Cargo.toml` files for workspace, storage, and client). Removed the direct dependency on `prometheus` from the root client crate, as it is now managed by the new metric crate. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542R12) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542R31) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-646c14b277a6afe2521324f3047193b744dfb61e924e1e1c6a1c71e7d12dd302R15) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-651fbc571d827abadd8e14ed21f83bc11941b8733f2d9704b93ae13b4dbfbb31R30) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-651fbc571d827abadd8e14ed21f83bc11941b8733f2d9704b93ae13b4dbfbb31L78)

### Docker and Build Integration

* Updated Dockerfiles (`ci/Dockerfile`, `ci/Dockerfile.debug`, `ci/Dockerfile.dfinit`) to copy the new metric crate and its source files into the build context, ensuring it is included in containerized builds. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-3e80aab0c5827bd91cc241afb47e7d83cf0c2dad29dd29c6be31d7ed46d7adecR32-R34) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-13f9c6664d42189b9dcb3443624a438ddd6ed0cab1893f225226779346027944R32-R34) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-4bc49af73ee4c312bbe45791f2bb95c950ecc719ca34b5bf59af0649db904dc5R32-R34)

### Code Cleanup

* Removed the old `metrics` module from `dragonfly-client/src/lib.rs`, as all metric logic is now handled by `dragonfly-client-metric`.
* Renamed and updated copyright in the metric module source file to reflect its new location and ownership.

### Storage Server Metrics

* Added calls to new metric collection functions in the TCP server handler (`tcp.rs`) to track upload piece start and failure events, improving observability for storage operations. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048R163-R167) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048R184-R186) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048R216-R220) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-e6030761b3759d42663011530a4dd2aacabf42891109d7be3965239b7c8ed048R244-R246)

title: refactor: tcp storage server and client

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request introduces multi-protocol support for the storage server and improves error handling and configuration in the Dragonfly client. The most significant changes are the addition of TCP and QUIC protocols for piece downloads, updates to configuration and error types, and enhancements to protocol selection logic in piece downloading.

### Multi-protocol storage server support

* The storage server configuration now supports both TCP and QUIC protocols, including new fields for protocol, IP, and port in `StorageServer`. Helper methods and logic for protocol-specific port selection were added. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-1d4c7839a6a08bcaef14196c90b20366303b24b2826e1bc9123574a815e7c1ddL197-R205) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-1d4c7839a6a08bcaef14196c90b20366303b24b2826e1bc9123574a815e7c1ddL965-R977) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-1d4c7839a6a08bcaef14196c90b20366303b24b2826e1bc9123574a815e7c1ddL986-R1000)
* The piece downloading logic in `Piece` was refactored to select the download protocol (TCP preferred, fallback to gRPC) based on peer information, enabling multi-protocol downloads. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-475bfaadbebd4a013fc563ecdf5dc59fc9f5258738fc46ff30b0ac3cea0ad515L70-R74) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-475bfaadbebd4a013fc563ecdf5dc59fc9f5258738fc46ff30b0ac3cea0ad515R97-R112) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-475bfaadbebd4a013fc563ecdf5dc59fc9f5258738fc46ff30b0ac3cea0ad515L444-R455) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-475bfaadbebd4a013fc563ecdf5dc59fc9f5258738fc46ff30b0ac3cea0ad515L454-R479)

### Configuration improvements

* The storage server's listen IP is now automatically set based on whether IPv6 is enabled, improving network configuration defaults.
* The client configuration and resource management were updated to pass protocol, IP, and port information throughout the download process, including in gRPC request handling. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1R789-R793) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1R840-R842) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1R1497-R1501) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1R1544-R1546) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8R1035-R1037)

### Error handling enhancements

* New error variants were added to `DFError` for protocol-specific failures, including vortex protocol errors and more precise timeout errors (`DownloadPieceFinishedTimeout`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-30b34d1fd4f012f66569fffc95749e5627c7a8bb3720dbcea2fa6659a7a5f85bL67-R67) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-30b34d1fd4f012f66569fffc95749e5627c7a8bb3720dbcea2fa6659a7a5f85bR161-R172) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-30b34d1fd4f012f66569fffc95749e5627c7a8bb3720dbcea2fa6659a7a5f85bR189-R192)
* All usages of the previous timeout error were updated to use the new, more descriptive error type. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eL526-R526) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eL575-R575) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eL950-R950) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eL1006-R1006)

### Dependency and workspace updates

* Added `vortex-protocol` as a workspace dependency to enable protocol support.

### Rate limiter and resource management

* The `PersistentCacheTask` and `Piece` resource structures were updated to accept and use externally provided rate limiters for download, upload, and prefetch operations, improving resource control and modularity. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8R47) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8R94-R105)

---

Other minor changes include a version bump for the `dragonfly-api` dependency to ensure compatibility with protocol changes.

title: docs: update community section in README

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request updates the community section in the `README.md` to provide clearer instructions and improve organization for contributors. The changes make it easier to find ways to get involved and clarify mailing list information.

Community section improvements:

* Expanded the introduction to encourage community growth and clarified ways to get involved.
* Updated the GitHub Discussions link to use a reference-style link for consistency.
* Organized mailing lists under a new "Mailing Lists" heading, separating developers and maintainers.
* Changed "DingTalk" to "DingTalk Group" and simplified the group reference format.

Changelog

Sourced from github/codeql-action's changelog.

CodeQL Action Changelog

See the releases page for the relevant changes to the CodeQL CLI and language packs.

[UNRELEASED]

  • We have improved the CodeQL Action's ability to validate that the workflow it is used in does not use different versions of the CodeQL Action for different workflow steps. Mixing different versions of the CodeQL Action in the same workflow is unsupported and can lead to unpredictable results. A warning will now be emitted from the codeql-action/init step if different versions of the CodeQL Action are detected in the workflow file. Additionally, an error will now be thrown by the other CodeQL Action steps if they load a configuration file that was generated by a different version of the codeql-action/init step. #3099 and #3100
  • We added support for reducing the size of dependency caches for Java analyses, which will reduce cache usage and speed up workflows. This will be enabled automatically at a later time. #3107

3.30.3 - 10 Sep 2025

No user facing changes.

3.30.2 - 09 Sep 2025

  • Fixed a bug which could cause language autodetection to fail. #3084
  • Experimental: The quality-queries input that was added in 3.29.2 as part of an internal experiment is now deprecated and will be removed in an upcoming version of the CodeQL Action. It has been superseded by a new analysis-kinds input, which is part of the same internal experiment. Do not use this in production as it is subject to change at any time. #3064

title: refactor: move the shutdown crate to the util package

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
This pull request refactors how the `shutdown` module is imported and organized across the `dragonfly-client` codebase. The main change is to remove the local `shutdown` module from `dragonfly-client` and instead consistently import it from the new `dragonfly-client-util` crate. This improves modularity and code organization by centralizing shutdown logic in a shared utility crate.

**Refactoring and Module Organization:**

* Removed the local `shutdown` module from `dragonfly-client` by deleting its declaration in `dragonfly-client/src/lib.rs` and updating all imports to use `dragonfly-client-util::shutdown` instead.
* Added the new `shutdown` module to the `dragonfly-client-util` crate by declaring it in `dragonfly-client-util/src/lib.rs`.

**Import Updates Across the Codebase:**

* Updated all files in `dragonfly-client` that previously imported `shutdown` locally to now import it from `dragonfly-client_util`, including `announcer`, `dynconfig`, `gc`, `grpc/dfdaemon_download`, `grpc/dfdaemon_upload`, `health`, `metrics`, `proxy`, and `stats` modules. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2f5fa9773cd3fe93b2f904e42003a63c6e6b085bc1c7a2143adfe195cc98e939L18) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2f5fa9773cd3fe93b2f904e42003a63c6e6b085bc1c7a2143adfe195cc98e939L27-R26) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-21f8fea8c3702b227f935718095452e3bf088969df4344f4dd9c7a9b0557572eL19-R24) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-cfa731d3c9a1cae126b87183eb862b9c4149ab3f19300d94c55580e53797a2ccL18-R23) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dL27) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-303fb9e5802b43f6e4657a81ed3ea511a911a64d8bf32abb0d1bea5cc127498dR51) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1L26) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-ee96a329b9be744aa8bbeb4c7c8936c29ba529c4a4e51778ca7bfd31684c26a1R53) [[9]](diffhunk://#diff-5cc8f0fa485e1ef00e3c0ca194da3d66b3c3f46b3a1d576b5aeec0f14c50e8b6L17-R17) [[10]](diffhunk://#diff-2bed13877d63556b6f5d2e6bbe266693bd6e448b818486df45c9539e173f0888L17-R21) [[11]](diffhunk://#diff-6421011d65f9faa2a693ea46e321cc00e07b77ef8792a1b795d1db98d9e5ec4cL23) [[12]](diffhunk://#diff-6421011d65f9faa2a693ea46e321cc00e07b77ef8792a1b795d1db98d9e5ec4cR34) [[13]](diffhunk://#diff-eb6198fb900d9d3ba8022bb478668d4b0042b45b750eee5862b1b020a7ae1693L17-R17)

title: refactor(downloader): streamline download concurrency handling

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request mainly refactors how concurrency is managed in piece downloading tasks, improving resource cleanup and simplifying the code. The most important changes are grouped below:

Concurrency management and resource cleanup:

* Replaced calls to `join_set.detach_all()` and `join_set.abort_all()` with `join_set.shutdown().await` throughout the piece collection and download logic for better task cleanup and graceful shutdown. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8L275-R275) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8L1236-R1240) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8L1266-R1277) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-6ea5ff95da7d753fc022fc87083cf177a54d95cfa82a14e2db9aba9f9a7b7824L293-R293) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-6ea5ff95da7d753fc022fc87083cf177a54d95cfa82a14e2db9aba9f9a7b7824L553-R553) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1243-R1247) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1457-R1469) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1486-R1498) [[9]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1513-R1525)

Semaphore usage and task spawning refactor:

* Moved semaphore acquisition outside of the download task functions, acquiring permits before spawning tasks and passing them into async blocks, rather than acquiring inside the download logic. This change simplifies the download function signatures and ensures concurrency is managed at the task spawning level. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8L1045-L1046) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8L1064-L1072) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-f95fb90718c7b67c4be3b2561b7ef633f021db56a99b04eb237aa1dac285ebf8L1206-R1227) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1015-L1016) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1033-L1043) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1177-R1199) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1307-L1315) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1421-R1453) [[9]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1687-R1699) [[10]](diffhunk://#diff-c7b7b9968d56a9246c8cbfb03440b01e70293fcae9082d1b2c18d3942551f7c5L1701-L1708)

Dependency and version updates:

* Updated workspace package version to `1.0.18` and bumped all internal dependency versions to match, ensuring consistency across the project. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L15-R15) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L25-R31)

Minor improvements and fixes:

* Changed error message formatting in `BackendError` to add a colon for clarity.
* Added a missing `#[cfg(target_os = "linux")]` for the `tracing::warn` import in the filesystem utility module to prevent compilation issues on non-Linux platforms.

title: fix(fs): handle unsupported fallocate errors gracefully

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request makes minor updates to the workspace versioning and improves filesystem compatibility in the project.

Version updates:

* Bumped the workspace package version in `Cargo.toml` from `1.0.16` to `1.0.17`, and updated all internal dependencies to use the new version for consistency. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L15-R15) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L25-R31)

Filesystem compatibility:

* Updated the `fallocate` function in `dragonfly-client-util/src/fs/mod.rs` to gracefully handle unsupported fallocate operations by logging a warning and skipping preallocation, improving compatibility with filesystems that do not support this feature.

title: feat: add the request sdk in dragonfly-client-util

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
This pull request introduces significant enhancements to the `dragonfly-client-util` crate, focusing on expanding its functionality and improving error handling. The main changes include the addition of new modules (`request` and `selector`), a comprehensive error handling system for request operations, and several new dependencies to support these features.

**New modules and error handling:**

* Added new modules: `request` and `selector` to `dragonfly-client-util/src/lib.rs`, laying the groundwork for extended request handling and selection logic.
* Introduced a robust error handling system in `dragonfly-client-util/src/request/errors.rs`, including a new `Error` enum and detailed error types (`BackendError`, `ProxyError`, `DfdaemonError`) for distinguishing between different failure scenarios in client operations.

**Dependency updates:**

* Added several new dependencies to `Cargo.toml` (such as `tonic`, `reqwest-middleware`, `futures`, `thiserror`, `bytes`, `protobuf`, `hashring`, `tonic-health`, `local-ip-address`, `hostname`, `dashmap`, and new dev-dependencies for testing/mocking), enabling gRPC support, advanced HTTP handling, error management, and improved testing capabilities.
* Moved the `reqwest` dependency from the main `[dependencies]` section to the workspace-managed section for better dependency management.<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

title: chore(dependencies): update project dependencies and version

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request updates several dependencies and refactors how HTTP clients and TLS providers are handled in the backend, particularly for object storage and HTTP modules. It also improves the way object storage operators are constructed, simplifies OSS credential handling, and adjusts test cases accordingly.

Dependency and compatibility updates:
* Updated multiple dependencies in `Cargo.toml`, including `dragonfly-client` packages to version `1.0.16`, downgraded `dragonfly-api` to `2.1.59`, updated `reqwest`, `hyper-rustls`, `rustls`, and replaced a git dependency on `opendal` with a crates.io version (`0.48.0`). TLS-related features and versions were also adjusted for compatibility. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L15-R15) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L25-R46) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L56-R62) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L84-R86) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L101-R103)

Backend code improvements:
* Removed explicit initialization of the `ring` crypto provider for TLS in the HTTP and object storage backends, relying on the default provider instead. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acL47-L49) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-f54c33c0ce074f6cd19d4a52f22bc25e5d0b9181fa00bddb3aaa9fb76b0276acL414-L415) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37L185-L187)
* Added HTTP/2 keep-alive settings to the object storage backend to improve connection stability. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6acac939bcda338ef32b3d844b2a6dad132f231935dd23bb8eead046b3effe94R42-R47) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37R190-R192)

Object storage operator construction:
* Refactored all object storage operator builders to inject the shared HTTP client directly via `.http_client()` instead of layering with `HttpClientLayer`, simplifying the code and reducing redundancy. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37R257) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37L276) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37L289-R287) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37L309) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37R343-L351) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37L362-R392) F9b7bc8cL426R426, F9b7bc8cL468R468)
* Simplified and unified OSS (Alibaba Cloud Object Storage) credential requirements: now only `access_key_id`, `access_key_secret`, and `endpoint` are required, removing the optional `security_token` logic. Error messages and test cases were updated accordingly. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37L362-R392) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37L789-R761) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37L813) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37L1115-R1121)

Metadata and listing improvements:
* When listing objects in HDFS and object storage backends, now explicitly request `ContentLength` and `Mode` metadata for each entry, improving the detail of returned information. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-cd1d5e18ab53a872f52409d8f57a522927798574e1bd8a3d6b9523ba20b9c661L20-R20) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-cd1d5e18ab53a872f52409d8f57a522927798574e1bd8a3d6b9523ba20b9c661R113) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37L20-R20) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-aa82735c59a36c00c1b1bbc938f96d6e5f0d02f86eebdc05e9b8120356da6e37R516)

title: refactor(cache): remove WriteCachePieceResponse struct

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request refactors the way piece content is read and written to the cache in the `dragonfly-client-storage` crate. The main change is the switch from using an intermediate `Vec<u8>` buffer and `tokio::io::copy` to using a `BytesMut` buffer and the `AsyncReadExt::read_buf` method, which streamlines the process and improves efficiency. In addition, an unused response struct was removed, and some minor imports were added.

**Refactoring and efficiency improvements:**

* Replaced the use of a `Vec<u8>` buffer and `tokio::io::copy` with a `BytesMut` buffer and `AsyncReadExt::read_buf` for reading piece content, reducing intermediate allocations and simplifying the code in the `Storage::write_piece` and `Storage::write_piece_from_parent` methods (`dragonfly-client-storage/src/lib.rs`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eL961-R979) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eL1027-L1044)
* Updated the calls to `metadata.download_piece_finished` to use the original `length` parameter instead of the computed content length, reflecting the new buffer handling (`dragonfly-client-storage/src/lib.rs`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eL961-R979) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eL1058-R1047)

**Code cleanup:**

* Removed the unused `WriteCachePieceResponse` struct from `cache/mod.rs` to clean up dead code.

**Dependency and import updates:**

* Added imports for `bytes::BytesMut` and `tokio::io::AsyncReadExt` to support the new buffer handling approach (`dragonfly-client-storage/src/lib.rs`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eR17) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-09bca31ba146d9bc116819606a37c3f4073946a1e2af40382b3c41e440869e6eR29)

title: feat(object_storage): add security token to OSS initialization

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
This pull request updates the OSS object storage initialization logic to ensure that all required credentials are provided together, improving security and correctness. The changes focus on how the `Operator` is initialized with credentials in the `ObjectStorage` implementation.

Credential handling improvements:

* Updated the main OSS operator initialization to require `access_key_id`, `access_key_secret`, `security_token`, and `endpoint` all to be present before proceeding, and added `.security_token(security_token)` to the builder.
* Updated the fallback OSS operator initialization to require `access_key_id`, `access_key_secret`, and `endpoint` (instead of just `security_token` and `endpoint`), and now sets `access_key_id` and `access_key_secret` on the builder instead of just `security_token`.
